turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Cowboys–Steelers rivalry.
turn.1: What was the geographic basis of the Cowboys–Steelers rivalry?
turn.2: Today there are significant numbers of persons living in the Dallas Metroplex and Houston that were born and raised in the Pittsburgh region, as well as significant numbers of North Texans living in the southern and western areas of the Pittsburgh Metropolitan region.
turn.4: The roots to the Cowboys–Steelers rivalry can be traced several years before the Cowboys played a game, and to another team entirely.
turn.6: Following the 1951 NFL season, New York Yanks owner Ted Collins sold his team back to the NFL due to financial difficulties competing with the New York Giants in the same market, as well as the All-America Football Conference folding just two years before and putting a severe drain on the team.
turn.7: Where did the team move to?
turn.8: Not wanting the team to compete with the Giants in the same market, the NFL decided to move the rights to the franchise to either the Dallas – Fort Worth Metroplex or Baltimore.
turn.9: Why was the team moved to Baltimore?
turn.10: Baltimore had previously been home to an NFL team, the original Baltimore Colts which had come over from the AAFC along with the Cleveland Browns and San Francisco 49ers, but had folded after the 1950 NFL season due to financial difficulties despite strong fan support.
turn.11: Why was the team moved to Dallas?
turn.12: Dallas, and the state of Texas in general, was a true expansion market that was untapped, and the NFL owners liked the appeal that Dallas offered due to the aforementioned following of football in the state.
